preface.title: Preface
preface.para: This package adds the support to create slaves tickets from a master that follows their master updates.

If you have questions regarding this document or if you need further information, please log in to our customer portal at portal.otrs.com with your OTRS ID and create a ticket. You do not have an OTRS ID yet? Register here for free.

section.title: Basic Mode
section.para: It's the default mode for this package.
In basic mode it is possible to define a master ticket and some slaves tickets that follows master tickets updates:

warning.para: In basic mode Master Slave status can't be changed.

section.title: Advanced Mode
section.para: The advanced mode allows to make the use of the Master Slave relations more flexible by adding support to the following actions:

listitem.para: Slave tickets can be changed into new masters.
Master tickets can be turned into slaves tickets of other master ticket.
Master tickets can become normal tickets.
Slave tickets can become normal tickets.

note.para: Above features can be enabled or disabled on SysConfig, for more information take a look in the "Configuration" chapter.

section.title: MasterSlave Screen
section.para: A new button "MasterSlave" is set to the ticket menu in the ticket zoom screen.

note.para: While this screen is available also in Basic Mode, the "Master Ticket" field is not available, it's only in advanced mode where this screen will let the change of the Master Slave status.

section.title: Bulk Action
section.para: If Advanced mode is enabled, bulk action screen enables the "Master Ticket field to allow the change of the MasterSlave status.

section.title: Replace customer's from Master ticket
section.para: When a new article is created on the Master ticket, the Slave tickets replicates the article using the customer from the Master and not the own from the Slave.
Enabled article types defined in the SysConfig option 'ReplaceCustomerRealNameOnSlaveArticleTypes' will retain the customer that is set in the Slave tickets for Master ticket replicated articles.

section.title: Create a Master Ticket
section.para: At the end of this example a new master ticket will be created.

listitem.para: Fill all mandatory elements of the screen
From "Master Ticket" select "New Master Ticket" and create the ticket
Write down the new ticket number (*****)
Zoom into the ticket to check the Master Slave status

section.title: Create A Slave Ticket
section.para: At the end of this example a new slave ticket will be created.

listitem.para: Be sure you have at least one Master ticket on the system
Fill all mandatory elements of the screen
From "Master Ticket" select "Slave of Ticket# *****: <Title>" and create the ticket
Zoom into the ticket to check the Master Slave status

section.title: Make Slave ticket To Follow Master Updates
section.para: At the end of this example the slave ticket will have a different priority by changing the master.

note.para: For this example we will change the priority of the master ticket but there are other activities that can be done instead to test this behavior, like change the state, the owner, the responsible, the lock status, reply the ticket or add a note.

section.para: For this example the two tickets created in the above examples will be used.
Make sure that both tickets have a different priority than the one to be set for this example we will set priority "1 very low", so the tickets should be in a priority greater than "1 very low".

listitem.para: Open the priority screen by clicking on the "Priority" button in the ticket menu
Fill any mandatory field and set the priority to "1 very low" and submit
Zoom into the slave ticket (This can be done quickly from the master ticket linked items table).
Look at the priority of the slave ticket.

section.title: Change The Master Slave Status
section.para: By the end of this tests the Master Slave status of a ticket will be changed

note.para: Depending on the current Master Slave status of the tickets, the enabled settings and the status of other tickets, different options will be presented in the "Master Ticket" field.

section.para: Make sure to enable the following options in the "SysConfig" settings:

warning.para: The most important setting to be enable is "MasterSlave::AdvancedEnabled", if it is not enabled then the "Master Ticket" field will not appear

listitem.para: Open Master Slave screen by click in in the "Master Slave" button in the ticket menu

Expand "Master Field" dropdown, the following options will appear:
New Master Ticket
Unset Slave Ticket

note.para: If there are other master tickets, for example: ticket number $$$$$, then other options will appear like "Slave of Ticket# $$$$$: <Title>", one per master ticket.

listitem.para: Take a look to the new Master status in the "Ticket Information" box

note.para: As an additional test a change in the priority on the original master can be made, now the changed of the original master will not affect the former slave ticket.

chapter.title: Technical Implementation Details
chapter.para: Master Slave relations are based in Parent Child link relations.
The package adds a new dynamic field type (MasterSlave). The creation of more fields of this type is not possible.
Master Slave information is stored in the dynamic_field_value table as any other dynamic field.

To make slave tickets to follow master updates there is ticket event module (Kernel::System::Ticket::Event::MasterSlave.pm) that catches the events from the master ticket and replicates them into its slaves.
